required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: A Non-Inferiority Trial of Metacognitive Therapy Versus Exposure and Response Prevention for Individuals With Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: Cognitive behavior therapy is the most effective treatment of obsessive-compulsive disorder. However, the majority of treated patients remain symptomatic. The metacognitive therapy by Wells (1997) could achieve substantial gains in first pilot studies. The purpose of this study is to investigate this approach with a randomized controlled trial by comparing metacognitive therapy with exposure and response prevention for obsessive-compulsive disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to investigate metacognitive therapy by Wells (1997) with a randomized controlled trial by comparing metacognitive therapy with exposure and response prevention for obsessive-compulsive disorder.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Severity (Yale Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale; Y-BOCS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: at pretest (admission), after completion of 6 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 6 weeks), at posttest after completion of 12 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 12 weeks), at follow-up (6 months after end of treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Change in Symptom Severity (Yale Brown Obsessive-Compulsive Scale; Y-BOCS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Severity (Padua Inventory; PI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at pretest (admission), after completion of 6 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 6 weeks), at posttest after completion of 12 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 12 weeks), at follow-up (6 months after end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in Symptom Severity (Padua Inventory; PI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in general psychopathology (Symptom Checklist-90-Revised, SCL-90-R)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at pretest (admission), after completion of 6 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 6 weeks), at posttest after completion of 12 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 12 weeks), at follow-up (6 months after end of treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Change in general psychopathology (Symptom Checklist-90-Revised, SCL-90-R)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Metacognitions (Metacognitions Questionnaire, short version, MCQ-30)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at pretest (admission), after completion of 6 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 6 weeks), at posttest after completion of 12 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 12 weeks), at follow-up (6 months after end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.description: Change in Anxiety (Beck Anxiety Inventory, BAI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom Severity (Clinical Global Impressions; CGI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at pretest (admission), after completion of 6 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 6 weeks), at posttest after completion of 12 therapeutic sessions (after an expected average of 12 weeks), at follow-up (6 months after end of treatment)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately after completion of therapy (after an expected avarage of 12 weeks)

arm_group.description: Metacognitive Therapy for OCD according to Wells (1997)
Exposure and Response Prevention for OCD according to Kozak & Foa (1997)

intervention.description: Metacognitive Therapy for OCD according to Wells (1997)
Exposure and Response Prevention for OCD according to Kozak & Foa (1997)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary diagnosis: obsessive-compulsive disorder
- German-speaking
- Agreeing to participate, verified by completion of informed consent
- Stable medication (at least 4 weeks)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current or past diagnosis of substance dependence, psychosis, neurological conditions
- Mental retardation
